alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 6:07PM EDT until June 16 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following counties, Chesterfield, Fairfield, Kershaw, Lancaster, Lee, Richland and Sumter. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 607 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Columbia, Camden, Lake Wateree Dam, Kershaw, Elgin, Lugoff, Westville, Goodale State Park, Longtown, Liberty Hill, Lake Wateree State Park, Cassatt, Lake Carolina, Villages at Sandhill, Blythewood, Bethune, Pine Grove Fire Station, North Towne Square Shopping Center and Dekalb. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 83 and 103. Interstate 77 between mile markers 23 and 27. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
